Company: PowerTrain Inc., Wood Sales Inc., and Tool Mart Inc.
Description: Mississippi-based PowerTrain Inc., Wood Sales Inc., and Tool Mart Inc., (collectively known as PowerTrain) agreed to jointly pay a civil penalty of $2 million to resolve claims that the company imported and sold almost 80,000 nonroad engines and equipment that were not covered by emissions-related certificates of conformity, and in most cases could not be certified because they exceeded emissions standards under the Clean Air Act.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Info Source: Extracted from a download of the EPA's Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO) ICIS FE&C file downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at http://echo.epa.gov/tools/data-downloads#downloads
